content.description: Same start at The Mob, but topout using the right arête.
Large pitch with some good hold
Stand start with a left hand undercling/pinch and climb the direct face to the point above.
content.location: On the west face of the Chargois (shar-gwah) boulder

content.description: Starts in the pit on the backside of the Myndset Boulder. Sit-start with a left hand sidepull and right hand on a pinch on   the bottom arête of the boulder. Using the crimp/sidepulls on the face, reach for the right arête to get up to the prow and topout. Using the left arête drops it to V3

This short problem begins with a surprisingly difficult sit-start and sequence dependent movement up the arête. Topout left of the first point and continue up the easy slab. As of Dec 2016 this problem had a fallen tree blocking it
content.location: Just south of the Chargois boulder, on the west side of the boulder cluster

content.description:
The mega line on this side of the boulder that traverses the whole thing before the hard topout of Born in Nov. 

  SDS on the start jug of Law of Attraction, but bump to the small rail out left and continue traversing (below the lip) and finish on Born in November
content.location: North face of the North boulder

content.description: One of the most striking boulders at the Fort. A future Oklahoma classic.Put up in Jan 2019. Climbs the right facing rail from its start all the way on the left arete to finish, with a few holds on the face to either side.
content.location: West of the Colony boulder. It faces the road

content.description: SDS in the middle of the north face, move up through the bird-bath jug, and topout, finishing on the slab
content.location: North side of the North boulder

content.description: start on the large hold at the bottom right corner of the boulder.   Climb the arête to the sloper at the top of the prow and topout.
content.location: On the first boulder you reach from the road

content.description: stand-start on the large crimp rail in the middle of   the face, move through one or two crimps, then move for the left arête and topout
Start low matched on a jug with a high left foot. Work your way up and right into low quality rock with some decent movement. Pop left for a slight horn on the lip and top out.
content.location: On the Colony boulder found if you head right after the Mob boulder at the entrance. This will be on the face that you first see as you approach.

content.description: Start on a good right hand on the right side of the block, left hand on a crimp to the left. Gain the lip and mantle. Hilariously low to the ground but makes for an incredible top out and mantle trainer.
content.location: located 15 ft to the left of Butterfly Effect facing the road

content.description: Stand start that goes straight up and slightly left for the topout (I believe)
content.location: 30ft north of A Date With Elegance on the south side of an egg-shaped boulder

content.description: SDS on the low jug, move through the two sloper dishes, then topout up/left and finish on the slab
content.location: NW corner of the North boulder

content.description: Start on the right facing rail, move up to the left angling sloper rail, then finish up and right a little below the top point of the boulder
content.location: On the west side (facing the road) of the North boulder, about 100ft north of the Myndset boulder

content.description: From the left side of the Boulder, traverse right on slopers, and then top out
content.location: On the south end of an 8ft tall boulder that is about 30ft east of the Football boulder (Fourth and Long)

content.description: Same start as Hundred Dollar Bet (right facing rail to left angling sloper rail), but then move up/left to the arete and work it up to the top corner and topout
content.location: West (road facing) side of the North boulder

content.description: Climbs the overhanging column feature. SDS with left hand on sloper or 1/4 pad crimp sidepull, and right hand on 1/2 pad sidepull. Bump right hand, then work up the column and topout up and left
content.location: SW corner of the Football boulder, about 50ft south of the Chargois boulder

content.description: Fun warm-up next to Fourth and Long. Follow the vine up the boulder. Nice holds along the right side of the mossy face, near the middle of the rock.
content.location: To the right side of Fourth and Long.

content.description: SDS problem that follows the arete and crack up to the notch, then topout
content.location: Football Boulder, about 10ft left of Fourth and Long

content.description: The direct start to Born in November. SDS below the arete and climb straight up, making use of a hold of two around the left arete
content.location: NE corner of the North boulder

content.description: SDS with feet on bad smears, right hand sloping gaston and left hand crimp. Do a big move to a crimp and proceed to keep tension and manage small holds on the arête. Top out after gaining jugs at the peak of the arête.
content.location: Just to the east of Ant Fortress

content.description: Start low in a jug slot and head right to a crimp rail. Do a hard left hand move to a sloping edge and work slightly right through crimps. Prepare for a somewhat tricky press mantle top out.
content.location: Continue past the Mob boulder turning right. This climb is on the left face from when you first approach the boulder.

content.description: sit-start below the south corner of the boulder with a right hand sloper and left hand crimp in the thin crack. Climb the left angling arête to the top edge and topout.
content.location: On the Chargois (shar-gwah) boulder, south of the Myndset and Colony boulders

content.description: Starts on the Northwest corner of the boulder on a right hand crimp and left hand sloper on the lip. Traverse from right to left on the immaculate slopers and crimps to topout on an amazing jutting block feature. Stellar.
content.location: the north side of the Chargois or "butterfly" boulder

content.description: Sit-start using the jug on the arête, pinch your way up the arête and use the sloper/pinch out right before topping out directly above
content.location: Arete just left of A Date with Elegance

content.description: SDS on The Northside, but quickly traverse left and using an edge of pocket around the left arete, jump for the lip and topout above
content.location: NNW side of the North boulder

content.description: Start sitting with left hand on the arête and right hand on the bulby undercling. Pick your poison by venturing into compression or remaining on the arête. Similar difficulty either way.
content.location: From Happy Camper go south about 100ft

content.description: SDS to "Shoelace Belt". Start with a low left hand crimp and a sharp incut right hand crimp. Do one hard move into the sidepull edge and climb Shoelace Belt.
content.location: Myndset Boulder

content.description: SDS on the jug (same as Law of Attraction) below the arete and finish up/right
content.location: NW corner of the North boulder

content.description: SDS on The Northside, but move up/right and finish where Law of Attraction does
content.location: N side of the North boulder

content.description: SDS the left (NE) corner, traverse right across the lip, pull around the corner using the W face of the boulder, and topout
content.location: Just SE of the Chargois boulder

content.description: Sit start the obvious vertical seam in the face.A short but very clean line on some of the best rock in the area looked to be a great problem, until the obvious aesthetic line was avoided by the first ascensionist by trending right instead of straight up with shouldery and scrunchy beta. The new line is quite fun although a bit dabby and size dependent. The quality direct line is still awaiting a first ascent and seems to be much harder.
content.location: South side of The Fort. On the face of Happy Camper.

content.description: Starts head height matched in the hueco. Move straight up through series of huecos to crimp rail. Do a big move to the lip and top out.
content.protection: At least two pads and a spotter. It's big :)
content.location: Main area. Next to Happy Camper.

content.description: Sit-start with hands on the large square hold 3ft right of the arête. Climb straight up through beautiful slopers and topout directly above.
content.location: NE of the Myndset boulder

content.description: Quality sandstone bouldering along a forested cliff band. The topouts are guaranteed to be covered in moss, but a quick brushing can fix that. There are plenty of established problems, but many more could be put up.
